content.body: annevk: I'm not sure it's really a good use of time...
content.formatted_body: annevk: I'm not sure it's really a good use of time...

content.body: Yeah... And they didn't reply to our comments about that either ☹️

> Regardless, an implementation of a given set of IDL fragments needs to be able to recognize all platform objects that are created by the implementation. https://webidl.spec.whatwg.org/#idl-objects

w/o having read the whole WebIDL spec to find out why, does anyone know what the reason for this is?

also, would be curious to know if the new IDL Object that we just released (`DOMException`) in Node.js v17.0.0 would be considered a _real_ "platform object" or if not, how we should classify these new objects that are to be backed by the IDL type system if they aren't already?
content.formatted_body:
Regardless, an implementation of a given set of IDL fragments needs to be able to recognize all platform objects that are created by the implementation. https://webidl.spec.whatwg.org/#idl-objects

w/o having read the whole WebIDL spec to find out why, does anyone know what the reason for this is?

also, would be curious to know if the new IDL Object that we just released (DOMException) in Node.js v17.0.0 would be considered a real "platform object" or if not, how we should classify these new objects that are to be backed by the IDL type system if they aren't already?

content.body: DerekNonGeneric: an implementation needs to be able to recognize platform objects so that it can properly implement the "is a platform object" checks in the Web IDL spec and elsewhere.
content.formatted_body: DerekNonGeneric: an implementation needs to be able to recognize platform objects so that it can properly implement the "is a platform object" checks in the Web IDL spec and elsewhere.

content.body: I suspect that DOMException should be considered as such in Node.js, e.g. for structuredClone().
yeah, so we will likely need to write up something like `isPlatformObject()`, but whether or not we should expose it is another story
content.formatted_body: yeah, so we will likely need to write up something like isPlatformObject(), but whether or not we should expose it is another story

content.body: I'm not sure how Node does things, but I've been looking into implementing serializable platform objects in Deno, and V8 requires you to have at least one internal field before it lets you define a custom serialization.
